title: Context propagation is not working for WebSocket.
body:
### Describe the bug

The context propagation is not working for WebSocket.
Please referred this post here.
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/discussions/30905#discussioncomment-4898246
@sberyozkin suggest that create a simple reproduce project to validate this. But I have no idea what bean can be injected to validate. Or maybe anyone other reproduce this.
From the thread name we can find the difference.

### Expected behavior

The context propagation should work for WebSocket. The security identity should be the same. Should not lost the authentication.
Here's a snapshot that context propagation is working
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159540/217496455-a188cb22-e638-4fd5-834f-b9e1aa91a77a.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159540/217496491-5b87a6d2-1f2c-4f6a-94e1-aa9a16dd39f8.png)


### Actual behavior

The context propagation is not working for WebSocket. The security identity become anonymous.
Here's a snapshot that context propagation is not working.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159540/217496550-9e2a3a52-43e2-4102-afba-74b09c5ed2d4.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159540/217496596-4a72c1a2-a87f-4018-a977-f0c098529843.png)

### How to Reproduce?

Just use the Actual behaviour code to reproduce. But it may need some settings with security.

I have no idea how to reproduce this without security.
